reviewText: Truly special.
Great good music. Awesome story
Good movie, not great.
The best of the best! They always will be especially to the older generations
I enjoyed finding out more about the personalities and history behind one of the all-time great vocal groups.  I would've given 5 stars, but I really wanted to hear mote singing.
Good documentary....couldn't watch the whole thing. They come from a relative's hometown....Piqua, Ohio
I loved this documentary.  I do wish they talked more about the brother died and I would have liked to know more about what they are doing today.  This group was one of my grandmother's favorites.
Love love love the Mills Brothers!!!!!

The Mills Brothers are one of those things the happen in a million years like Jimi Hendrix. The Mills Brothers are the root and Doo Wop is the fruit. Must get especially for there for movie clips back in the 30's and 40's. The imitating of musical instruments are most impressing. Sounds like the real thing.

I guess my main problem  was the lack of length of this video. I I remember as a kid watching The mills bros. on variety shows in the 60's. I would have liked to have seen more of those clips. It's unfortunate,but the Harry Mills on the video most of the time was not the one I remember.  All in all, being a Mills bros. fan I enjoyed it and could have used another hour.
We learned so much about this group.  What talent they had.  Too bad there aren't singers like them around now.
good
Production quality could have been better
Does not get any better!!!
I have been a life-long fan of the Mills Brothers.  They never sang a bad song, but their version of "Yellow Bird" gave me chills!
a bit long and a bit boring and redundant
Love watching movies and films about the great musicians of past. Brought back some fond memories.
I've  always loved the Mills Brothers and their ground breaking music.  Their history is amazing from the 1930s through the 1960s.  Interesting video biography of a great group.

Outstanding video of a group that I remember when I was growing up...and I got to meet them backstage years ago...what a nice story of how they made music since 1925. I highly recommend it to all who enjoy the songs we can still remember the words to.
Dave Casey
pacrtflt@aol.com
Excellent
Very nice documentary and a great group of guys!

In the late 1960s I was going to Powhatan Jr. High School in southern West Virginia. Money was extremely tight back then. My lunch cost 25 cents. The Mills brothers came to my school and gave a performance in the auditorium, admission was 25 cents. I went hungry that day ,but I saw a show I will remember for the rest of my life. It was a program that the state sponsored to expose the young people to culture It was only about an hour long, but it was great.. I am 63 yrs. old now, looking back I have to say it was one of the best deals I ever made in my life.

Great presentation of this group from beginning.
Nice behind the scenes video with a look into how they developed.
should be more videos like this for many other groups ( ink Spots, Lennon Sisters, etc)

Have heard of the Mills Brothers for most of my years but not much in last few years. I did not know their history which was a very interesting story. The music is great. I have suggested this video to others.  Yes, I plan to watch again.
A retro experience with the Brothers Mills and a trip down memory lane for oldsters like me!
Interesting stories and good music.
Fabulous music, grainy film.  I would give this five stars if the picture quality had been better.  Love the Mills Bros and enjoyed learning their story.  Too bad about the film.
I saw the Mills in Vegas in 1973. I was a kid. I loved them then and still. No one has come close. They were so natural and talented.
very entertaining and informative.
I was lovely to see some of their history
